lines.content: * The Duke class represent a chatbot called Duke that is able to take in user inputs
* and save these input in a storage.
* The filePath argument specify the file to be retrieved or created as the task list database.
* @param filePath File path containing the saved task list.
* The DukeException class encapsulates exceptions that occur when Duke is running.
* Initializes an instance of DukeException containing the detail message.
* The Storage class encapsulates the file used as a local database and its associated methods.
* The filePath argument specify the file used as a local database.
* @param filePath File path to the local database.
* @throws DukeException If unable to find, access, or read data from file.
throw new DukeException("Saved file is corrupted.");
* Creates a new directory and/or a new file for the {@link #filePath}.
* @throws DukeException If unable to create new file or/and new directory.
throw new DukeException("An error occurred when creating new file.");
throw new DukeException("Duke does not have access to write to file.");
* Overwrites the text stored in the {@link #file}.
System.out.println("An error occurred when saving the changes to file.");
* The TaskList class encapsulates the list of tasks and its associated methods.

* @param task Task to be added to the task list.
* Returns the number of tasks in the TaskList.

* Marks the n-th task of the TaskList.
* If isDone is true, mark the task as done, otherwise mark as not done.
* @param isDone Indicates whether task is done or not done.
* @throws DukeException If n - 1 is outside the bounds of TaskList' size.
public void markTaskN(int n, boolean isDone) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("The number you entered is not within the valid range.");
* Deletes the n-th task in the TaskList.

* Returns the n-th task in the TaskList.

* Returns a string representation of the TaskList in a specific format for storage.

* Displays the response after successfully adding a task to the list of task.
* @param taskDesc String representation of the task.
public void printAddTaskReply(String taskDesc, int totalTask) {
printMessage("Got it. I've added this task:\n\t" + taskDesc
+ "\nNow you have " + totalTask + " tasks in the list.");
* Displays the response after successfully marking a task as done.
* @param taskDesc String representation of the task.
printMessage("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n\t" + taskDesc);
* Displays the response after successfully marking a task as not done.
* @param taskDesc String representation of the task.
printMessage("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:\n\t" + taskDesc);
* Displays the response after successfully deleting a task.
* @param taskDesc String representation of the task.
public void printDeleteTaskReply(String taskDesc, int totalTask) {
printMessage("Noted. I've removed this task:\n\t" + taskDesc +
"\nNow you have " + totalTask + " tasks in the list.");
